newsitem.title: USA: Computer Network Technology sees Q4 charge.
newsitem.headline: Computer Network Technology sees Q4 charge.

text.p: Computer Network Technology Corp said Monday it expects to take a pre-tax charge of about $2.7 million, or $0.08 a share after tax, in the fourth quarter for the write-down of its purchased Brixton technology asset.
The write-down is necessary as a result of changing market conditions and evolving customer requirements that shortened the expected life of this asset, the company said.
Meanwhile, the company also said it expected to report 1996 revenues in the range of $95 million and $99 million, compared to $78.8 million reported for fiscal 1995.
The company said 1996 will show an operating profit from existing business units, excluding the write-down, but that it expects the write-down to lead to a loss for the fourth quarter of 1996.

The company also said it will reassign certain sales and technical support employees currently working in the Brixton market to other sales territories and will establish a separate business unit in order to improve product focus and profitability for the Brixton product line.
The company said it expects to release a new enterprise-wide application and data access product for the Brixton market in early 1997.
Computer Network Technology shares fell 1/2 to 5-1/4 Monday.
